Hi,

Am Dienstag, 8. April 2=
003 22:27 schrieb javainsel:
> > Actually, I find that I'm spending even *l=
arger* amounts of time
> > working
> > with my tests.  I haven't measured, =
but I'd have to guess around
> > 70%.

> If testing time is so high, then w=
ho wants to blame me for looking
> for Parasoft JTest to make testing more =
productive?
It's not the testing time.
It's the time coding tests.

It's no=
t possible to improve the testing time of JUnit.
It's only possible to impr=
ove the generation of Unit tests.
But as we already told you, DBC can't rep=
lace much of Unit testing, only small 
parts of it.

The idea of TDD, espec=
ially at Extreme Programming Java with Junit, is, that 
you write tests tha=
t force your classes to implement the business logic - use 
cases and busin=
ess objects - required to fulfill the customer's needs.
That's one more thi=
ng that can't be replaced by DBC.

> And you understand that DbC is not suc=
h a bad idea as some people
> here believe.
I can remember posts that show =
that in general DBC isn't a better solution 
than Unit Testing.


Bye
